io.elimu.a2d2.cds.fhir.helper

Class QueryingServerHelperBase<T,U extends IBaseResource>

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.elimu.a2d2.cds.fhir.helper.QueryingServerHelperBase<T,U>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - the actual implementation of QueryingServerHelper
    U - the type of IBaseResource that will be returned by queries, since each FHIR model returns a different type
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Externalizable, java.io.Serializable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    QueryingServerHelper, QueryingServerHelper, QueryingServerHelper

    public abstract class QueryingServerHelperBase<T,U extends IBaseResource>
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Externalizable
    Base class for all implementations of QueryingServerHelper.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      T addAuthentication(java.lang.String authType, java.lang.String... params)
      Allows you to set authentication against the FHIR server, following pre-established structures.
      There are multiple ways to authenticate to a FHIR server, but here are provided a set of pre-established ways to call this method: addAuthentication("Basic", "user", "pass"): will add an Authorization: Basic headerValue HTTP header to every call done addAuthentication("Bearer", "bearertoken"): will add an Authorization: Basic bearertoken HTTP header to every call done addAuthentication("Header", "x-api-key: 1234"): will add an x-api-key: 1234 HTTP header to every call done addAuthentication("Header", "x-api-key", "1234"): will ALSO add an x-api-key: 1234 HTTP header to every call done addAuthentication("OAuth",
      "token_url", "https://path.to.your.auth.url/token",
      "client_id", "your-app-name",
      "grant_type", "password",
      "username", "your-user",
      "password", "your-password",
      "scope", "offline_access"):       this will request for a token from the token_url, using your-user:your-password as Basic auth, reuqest a token for client id your-app-name, and add it to the output The last option, OAuth, is the one that will be preferred.

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • addAuthentication

        public T addAuthentication(java.lang.String authType,
                           java.lang.String... params)
        Allows you to set authentication against the FHIR server, following pre-established structures.
        There are multiple ways to authenticate to a FHIR server, but here are provided a set of pre-established ways to call this method:
        • addAuthentication("Basic", "user", "pass"): will add an Authorization: Basic headerValue HTTP header to every call done
        • addAuthentication("Bearer", "bearertoken"): will add an Authorization: Basic bearertoken HTTP header to every call done
        • addAuthentication("Header", "x-api-key: 1234"): will add an x-api-key: 1234 HTTP header to every call done
        • addAuthentication("Header", "x-api-key", "1234"): will ALSO add an x-api-key: 1234 HTTP header to every call done
        • addAuthentication("OAuth",
          "token_url", "https://path.to.your.auth.url/token",
          "client_id", "your-app-name",
          "grant_type", "password",
          "username", "your-user",
          "password", "your-password",
          "scope", "offline_access"):           this will request for a token from the token_url, using your-user:your-password as Basic auth, reuqest a token for client id your-app-name, and add it to the output
        The last option, OAuth, is the one that will be preferred. The different values provided for the client id, token url, grant type, etc and all necessary fields is yet TBD on how they are going to be included into the process, but please assume that the rules that invoke a QueryingServerHelper with OAuth like this will have these values provided, and not hard-coded on the rules.
        Parameters:
        authType - one of "Basic", "Bearer", "Header", or "OAuth".
        params - a variable list of parameters, depending on the authType selected
        Returns:
        it returns itself, in case you want to call a chain of methods

      • addHeader

        public T addHeader(java.lang.String headerName,

        Adds an HTTP header, of any kind, to the requests made by the QueryingServerHelper
        Parameters:

        headerValue - the HTTP header value
        Returns:

      • getResourceByIdResponseNoCache

        public FhirResponse<IBaseResource> getResourceByIdResponseNoCache(java.lang.String resourceType,
                                                                  java.lang.String resourceId)
        Returns a specific Resource by ID. The return type is a FhirResponse wrapper for the HTTP response. Will contain a result and a response code. The main difference of this method with getResourceByIdResponse(String, String) is that this method will not cache the response for a few minutes.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the resourceType (i.e. Patient, Observation, etc)
        resourceId - the internal identifier to fetch
        Returns:
        the single object that is a result of invoking HTTP GET {baseurl}/{resourceType}?_id={resourceId}

      • getResourceByIdResponse

        public FhirResponse<IBaseResource> getResourceByIdResponse(java.lang.String resourceType,
                                                           java.lang.String resourceId)
        Returns a specific Resource by ID. The return type is a FhirResponse wrapper for the HTTP response. Will contain a result and a response code. This method will cache the response for 5 minutes if called again with the same parameters and authentication headers.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the resourceType (i.e. Patient, Observation, etc)
        resourceId - the internal identifier to fetch
        Returns:
        the single object that is a result of invoking HTTP GET {baseurl}/{resourceType}?_id={resourceId}

      • getResourceByIdInPathResponse

        public FhirResponse<IBaseResource> getResourceByIdInPathResponse(java.lang.String resourceType,
                                                                 java.lang.String resourceId)
        Returns a specific Resource by ID. The return type is a FhirResponse wrapper for the HTTP response. Will contain a result and a response code. This method will cache the response for 5 minutes if called again with the same parameters and authentication headers. The main difference this method has is that the call is done by path instead of by "_id" parameter, which is necessary for some servers when the authorization is restricted to a very limited scope.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the resourceType (i.e. Patient, Observation, etc)
        resourceId - the internal identifier to fetch
        Returns:
        the single object that is a result of invoking HTTP GET {baseurl}/{resourceType}/{resourceId}

      • getResourceByIdResponse

        public FhirResponse<IBaseResource> getResourceByIdResponse(java.lang.String resourceType,
                                                           java.lang.String resourceId,
                                                           boolean usePath)
        Returns a specific Resource by ID. The return type is a FhirResponse wrapper for the HTTP response. Will contain a result and a response code. This method will cache the response for 5 minutes if called again with the same parameters and authentication headers.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the resourceType (i.e. Patient, Observation, etc)
        resourceId - the internal identifier to fetch
        usePath - if true, the request query will be {baseurl}/{resourceType}/{resourceId}. If false, {baseurl}/{resourceType}?_id={resourceId}
        Returns:
        the single object that is a result of invoking HTTP GET on the query

      • getRetVal

        protected FhirResponse<java.util.List<IBaseResource>> getRetVal(java.lang.String resourceQuery,
                                                                FhirVersionEnum fhirVersion,
                                                                boolean paging)

      • queryResourcesResponseNoCache

        public FhirResponse<java.util.List<IBaseResource>> queryResourcesResponseNoCache(java.lang.String resourceType,
                                                                                 java.lang.String subjectId,
                                                                                 java.lang.String subjectRefAttribute,
                                                                                 java.lang.String fhirQuery)
        Returns a list of Resources from a specific filtering query. The return type is a FhirResponse wrapper for the HTTP response. Will contain a result and a response code. This method will not cache the response, so it will re-do the call if called immediately after for 5 minutes if called again with the same parameters and authentication headers.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the resourceType (i.e. Patient, Observation, etc)
        subjectId - the value of the main parameter to be used for filtering in the query
        subjectRefAttribute - the name of the main parameter to be used for filtering in the query
        fhirQuery - if more parameters are needed to filter, they are added here in the structure of an HTTP query
        Returns:
        the list of objects that is a result of invoking HTTP GET {baseurl}/{resourceType}?{subjectRefAttribute}={subjectId}&{fhirQuery}

      • queryResourcesResponse

        public FhirResponse<java.util.List<IBaseResource>> queryResourcesResponse(java.lang.String resourceType,
                                                                          java.lang.String subjectId,
                                                                          java.lang.String subjectRefAttribute,
                                                                          java.lang.String fhirQuery)
        Returns a list of Resources from a specific filtering query. The return type is a FhirResponse wrapper for the HTTP response. Will contain a result and a response code. This method will cache the response for 5 minutes if called again with the same parameters and authentication headers.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the resourceType (i.e. Patient, Observation, etc)
        subjectId - the value of the main parameter to be used for filtering in the query
        subjectRefAttribute - the name of the main parameter to be used for filtering in the query
        fhirQuery - if more parameters are needed to filter, they are added here in the structure of an HTTP query
        Returns:
        the list of objects that is a result of invoking HTTP GET {baseurl}/{resourceType}?{subjectRefAttribute}={subjectId}&{fhirQuery}

      • query

        public FhirResponse<java.util.List<IBaseResource>> query(QueryBuilder builder)
        Returns a list of Resources from a specific filtering query. The return type is a FhirResponse wrapper for the HTTP response. Will contain a result and a response code. This method will cache the response for 5 minutes if called again with the same parameters and authentication headers.
        Parameters:
        builder - a QueryBuilder to construct the query, auth, paging and any other query parameters
        Returns:
        the list of objects that is a result of invoking HTTP GET on the query built by QueryBUilder

      • queryAsync

        public FhirFuture<FhirResponse<java.util.List<IBaseResource>>> queryAsync(QueryBuilder builder,
                                                                          java.lang.String asyncId)
        Creates a separate thread where a query to the FHIR server will be done. The return type is a FhirFuture wrapper for the FhirResponse of that call. Will contain a result and a response code. This method will cache the response for 5 minutes if called again with the same parameters and authentication headers.
        Parameters:
        builder - a QueryBuilder to construct the query, auth, paging and any other query parameters
        asyncId - a name for the Future to be returned
        Returns:
        a FhirFuture with the asyncId as name, and ready to return the List of IBaseResource as result.

      • queryResourcesAsync

        public FhirFuture<FhirResponse<java.util.List<IBaseResource>>> queryResourcesAsync(java.lang.String resourceType,
                                                                                   java.lang.String subjectId,
                                                                                   java.lang.String subjectRefAttribute,
                                                                                   java.lang.String fhirQuery,
                                                                                   java.lang.String asyncId)
        Creates a separate thread where a query to the FHIR server will be done. The return type is a FhirFuture wrapper for the FhirResponse of that call. Will contain a result and a response code. This method will cache the response for 5 minutes if called again with the same parameters and authentication headers.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the resourceType (i.e. Patient, Observation, etc)
        subjectId - the value of the main parameter to be used for filtering in the query
        subjectRefAttribute - the name of the main parameter to be used for filtering in the query
        fhirQuery - if more parameters are needed to filter, they are added here in the structure of an HTTP query
        asyncId - a name for the Future to be returned
        Returns:
        a FhirFuture with the asyncId as name, and ready to return the List of IBaseResource as result.

      • getResourceByIdAsync

        public FhirFuture<FhirResponse<IBaseResource>> getResourceByIdAsync(java.lang.String resourceType,
                                                                    java.lang.String resourceId,
                                                                    java.lang.String asyncId)
        Creates a separate thread where a single resource fetch from the FHIR server will be done. The return type is a FhirFuture wrapper for the FhirResponse of that call. Will contain a result and a response code. This method will cache the response for 5 minutes if called again with the same parameters and authentication headers.
        Parameters:
        resourceType - the resourceType (i.e. Patient, Observation, etc)
        resourceId - the value of the id to fetch the resource
        asyncId - a name for the Future to be returned
        Returns:
        a FhirFuture with the asyncId as name, and ready to return the List of IBaseResource as result.
